themes_banned: dangerous imitable behavior (e.g., climbing railings, ingesting objects)

character_rules.age_presentation: peer-like or caregiver; no teen/adult romance
character_rules.diversity_inclusion: represent without stereotyping; avoid accents used as a joke

visual_rules.style: bright, high-contrast, clean shapes, non-noisy backgrounds
visual_rules.text_on_screen: large, legible, minimal, must be read aloud in narration

audio_music_rules.music_usage: light, cheerful; auto-duck under speech by 6–12 dB

calls_to_action_allowed: gentle learning prompts: 'Can you count with us?'
cta_brand_rules.branding: subtle logo/title card only; no product placement

cultural_sensitivity.festivals: generic celebration unless educator-reviewed cultural guidance is provided

platform_compliance.coppa: no data collection, no personalized ads
platform_compliance.privacy: no real child data or identifying info

dangerous_behavior_list: climb_balcony
ingest_non_food
play_with_sockets
play_in_traffic
run_away_from_caregiver
go_with_stranger
talk_to_stranger_without_permission
accept_gifts_from_stranger
enter_vehicle_with_stranger
wander_off_away_from_safe_zone
open_door_to_unknown_person
follow_stranger_request_to_hide
imitate_unsafe_online_challenge
share_personal_information_online
play_with_fireworks_or_flammables
unsupervised_swimming_or_water_body_play
use_weapon_or_tool_without_supervision
No knives, scissors, sharp tools without adult supervision
No fire, matches, lighters, stoves, candles
No outlets, cords, appliances, batteries in mouth
No choking hazards: marbles, coins, small parts near mouth
No climbing on high furniture, windows, balconies without railings
No running near roads, driveways, parking lots
No crossing streets without holding a caregiver’s hand
No entering water without an adult: pools, tubs, buckets, ponds
No head‑first sliding or diving; wear helmets where required
No plastic bags on head/face; no tying strings/cords around neck
No rough play that hits head/neck; no pushing/shoving near edges
No eating while running or lying down
No putting fingers in doors/hinges; careful with drawers
No taking medicine, vitamins, or unknown substances
No eating unknown plants, berries, powders
No following, talking to, or taking gifts from strangers
No opening the door to strangers; find a trusted adult
No leaving home, yard, school, or caregiver without permission
No sharing personal info (name, address) with strangers
No weapons, explosives, fireworks, or imitations used as play
No dangerous pranks/challenges or dares
